first_reasoning: We recommend allocating the full $10 million to the Consumer Products Division because its flat sales trajectory and near-break-even margins can be turned around quickly with targeted R&D. By investing in rapid-cycle prototyping, real-world market testing and pilot builds, we can deliver a tangible product refresh and reignite growth within the year. This approach minimizes wasted spend, keeps costs and scope visible via regular read-outs, and primes our manufacturing partners early—giving us the best shot at restoring positive earnings in 2013.
second_reasoning: We allocate the full R&D budget to the Consumer Products Division because its flat sales and near‐zero margins offer the fastest path to a measurable turnaround. By concentrating resources on rapid concept validation, cross-functional prototyping sprints, pilot builds and early tooling collaboration, we can deliver a breakthrough product and return to profitability by year-end. The Industrial Division’s longer development cycles cannot generate the urgent results we need in the same timeframe.
